statusHistory.description: Arlong Park is completely destroyed when Luffy's final attack causes structural collapse, reducing the building to rubble.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Discovers Nami's Blood-Covered Pen
keyEvents.description: In the cartography room, Luffy finds Nami's drawing pen covered in blood, revealing her suffering.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Destroys Arlong's Maps and Weapons
keyEvents.description: Luffy systematically destroys all the sea maps and furniture in the cartography room, throwing them out the window.

keyEvents.title: Arlong's Defeat
keyEvents.description: Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Ono sends Arlong crashing through five floors to the bottom of Arlong Park.

keyEvents.title: Destruction of Arlong Park
keyEvents.description: The structural damage from Luffy's final attack causes Arlong Park to completely collapse, symbolizing the end of Arlong's empire.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Declares Nami His Friend
keyEvents.description: Standing atop the ruins of Arlong Park, Luffy declares Nami his friend and crewmate.

description: A massive building complex serving as the headquarters of the Arlong Pirates. The structure featured multiple floors including a cartography room where Nami was forced to draw maps. Arlong Park symbolized fishman supremacy and oppression over the Conomi Islands until its destruction.
culturalSignificance: Arlong Park represented eight years of tyranny and oppression. Its destruction symbolizes the liberation of Cocoyasi Village and the surrounding islands from Arlong's rule.
notableFeatures: Multi-story building with cartography room on upper floor

statusHistory.description: Cocoyasi Village is freed from Arlong's oppression after Luffy defeats Arlong and destroys Arlong Park.

keyEvents.title: Cocoyasi Village Celebrates Liberation
keyEvents.description: After eight years of oppression, the villagers celebrate their freedom from Arlong's rule.

keyEvents.title: Genzo Apologizes to Nami
keyEvents.description: Back in the village, Genzo apologizes to Nami on behalf of all the townspeople for not understanding her sacrifice.

description: A peaceful village in the Conomi Islands that was terrorized by Arlong for eight years. Home to Nami, her adoptive sister Nojiko, and father figure Genzo. The village includes tangerine orchards (particularly Bell-mère's grove).
culturalSignificance: Nami's home village and the center of her emotional journey. The village's liberation represents Nami's freedom to pursue her own dreams.
